line.en: 'Wake up, Kotori! Breakfast has been ready for a\nwhile now!'
'Hey Kotori!!!'
'Urgg... Good morning... What time is it?'
'What?!'
'Breakfast is ready, so get changed and come\nhere!'
'Alright, alright'
'Thanks for the food! *Nom nom*'
Kotori, still looking rather sleepy, stuffs her\nface with food.
'Hey, Hat.'
'Quack.'
Hat joins in and eats some food, too.
'Good morning, Kotori-senpai.'
'Good morning, Habane-senpai.'
'Good morning, twins!'
'Did you sleep in, Kotori? That's not like you.'
'I was busy studying for exams last night...'
'My student ranking dropped after that last test.\nI have to regain my spot or I'll get an earful\nfrom Tobioka.'
'It's because you were busy with club activities.\nOh, and you have bedhead.'
'...Bleh'
While still holding her chopsticks and rice\nbowl,Kotori looks over at me.
'I can't believe you. *Sigh*'
I comb Kotori's hair with a brush from the\nwashroom.
'It's all tangled! You have such beautiful hair,\nyou should take care of it!'
'Ouch! Comb more gently, alright?'
'Sorry, it got stuck on something.'
'What will you do if I get split ends? I need to\nkeep my beautiful hair healthy!'
'Okay, okay.'
While talking, I brush Kotori's hair as carefully\nand gently as I can.
Just like she bragged, her hair really is\nluxurious and soft.
'Your hair feels so nice.'
'Doesn't it? Oh, and eat up, Hat!'
'Quack!'
'Somehow, I feel like I'm seeing something I\nshouldn't be seeing.'
'The worst part is that they aren't even aware.\nWhy don't you get him to comb your hair, too,\nSis?'
'What?! No, I'm fine as is!'
'Done with breakfast.'
'Okay! I'll clean it up, so you go prepare.'
'Okay!'
'You're really close to Kotori, aren't you, Aoi?'
'You think so?'
'I mean...Are you two dating?'
'W-Why would you say that?'
'What do you think, Sis?'
'Yeah...I though so, too.'
'No way! I guess we get along, but...'
'Aw, so you aren't?'
Why does Asa sound disappointed?!
What was she expecting?
'Anyways, we're 15 minutes behind schedule. Let's\nhurry up!'
'OK!'
Kotori has gotten energy from breakfast, her eyes\nalert and bright.
'Hang on tight!'
I ran with all my might while pushing Kotori's\nwheelchair with force.
'Run! Run!'
'Hey! Wait up!!'
'Pushing a wheelchair while bolting...Well this\nis a first.'
'Hurry up and push faster!'
Now, we're in the middle of final exams.
The student body are giving the test their all.
But as for us...
'With Amane back, it feels like things are\nfinally starting!'
'Even if Tobioka complains, as long as I can use\nthe runway, the race is mine!'
'I'll look down at him from the sky and spank his\nsorry ass!'
'Thats fine, but how about moving your hands?'
'We're doing a great job despite these tests,\nhuh?'
'I don't know about that. If we don't finish our\ntests as quickly as possible, we'll never make it\nin time.'
'For the Morning Glory!'
'Morning Glory will definitely come this summer!\nI'll make it happen in time!'
'Come on already! Quit getting all excited and\nmove your hands, alright?'
Kotori's overnight cramming seems to have paid\noff. She seemed to handle the test well.
'Sorry I'm late!'
Asa and Yoru entered.
'You're late! What were you doing?!'
'I, I'm sorry!'
'Hey club leader, weren't you the one who said\nparticipation was optional during tests?'
'Are you two okay? There are more tests tomorrow,\nyou know.'
'I'm fine, but as for my sister...'
Yoru takes a side glance at Asa, who hangs her\nhead.
'I, I think I'm fine!'
'If you fail, you're not getting invited! That\nwould be embarrassing for the Soaring Club!'
'Ungh... I'll do my best...'
'You're so excited it's getting annoying...'
'She's high from lack of sleep...'
'As soon as tests finish, it's summer vacation!\nAfter all, we don't know when Morning Glory will\ncome!'
'Speaking of which, what are you going to do for\nsummer vacation?'
'Now that you mention it, I hadn't decided on\nanything in particular.'
Our normal routine was to work from morning until\nnight, as much as time would permit. However, we\ncouldn't very well ask that of Asa.
'Right after summer vacation started last year,\nwe had a training camp, didn't we?'
'A training camp?!'
Asa's eye's sparkle with excitement.
Seeing this, Yoru says,
'...Hmph.'
seeming to find the whole thing troublesome.
'Let's do it again this year! A camp would be\nokay for me, too!'
'Nah, there isn't much reason to do it this\nyear.'
The camp paperwork was just done as an excuse to\nstay at school late.
Since the secret base isn't on school ground, we\ncan stay as long as we want without worrying\nabout complaints.
'That brings back memories! Amane and Ageha came\nto Flying Fish Manor, and then we made food and\nate together. Remember?'
'That was around the time we all became close.'
'Yeah, it was!'
'Until then, Kotori and I didn't get along at\nall!'
Ageha says this with a mean-spirited laugh.
'Th, that's all in the past!'
'Now we get along really well, don't we?'
Ageha clung to Kotori.
'I love you, Kotori!'
'It's sweltering! Get off me!'
Kotori pushes Ageha away with all her might.
'Hooo...'
Asa says, looking on with a moved--or maybe\njealous--face.
'After all, to strengthen our bond...'
'Nah, we're not going to do a camp.'
'Darn! Why not?'
Amane is busy, so she can't come. Asa is a\nboarding student. Ageha lives near here.
There's no point in staying at Flying Fish Manor.
'Aww... I wanted to have a camp, too!'
Asa looks miserable.
But I'm sure that when we hit summer vacation,\nthis secret base will be like a camp location\nanyway.
'By the way, Sis, aren't you forgetting\nsomething?'
'Forgetting something? Oh!'
Asa remembers something and rummages through her\nbag.
Then,
'Kotori, can I have a moment?'
Asa pulled Kotori to the edge of the dock.
We watch on from afar.
'Um, I was told to give this to you, Kotori.'
'What is this... a letter?'
'When I going home earlier, some guy called me\nover and asked me to give this to you.'
'I said no at first, but he wouldn't give up...\nHe seemed like a nice guy!'
'Well, I gave it to you, okay?'
The light pitter-patter of footsteps echoed, and\nthen only Asa returned, as if running away.
Kotori is absolutely still after receiving\nwhatever it was from Asa.
'What's wrong with her?'
'Um, well...'
Kotori opened the item she received from Asa and\nlooked inside.
After a while,
Kotori leaned back on her wheelchair and\nscreamed.
It was as if an explosive had been inside the\nobject.
'W, What happened!'
I hurried over, and...
Poof!
Kotori hurriedly hid the item in her hands behind\nher back.
As though it were something I was absolutely\nforbidden to see.
'...What's up with you? Your face is completely\nred!'
I had never before seen an expression that so\nperfectly fit the phrase 'beet red.
Kotori was blushing deeply, and tears welled up\nin her eyes. For some reason she was shivering.
'Kotori...?'
Kotori didn't speak. She turned to the side and\npushed the wheels on her wheelchair.
She sped away with extreme momentum.
'What happened to her...?'
As I stood there confused, the door opened again,\nand Kotori poked just her head out.
'Ageha! Ageha, get over here!!'
'What is it?'
'Just come over here!'
'W, w, what should I do!!'
'Do about what?!'
'About this! THIS!'
'Let me see. ...Is this a love letter?'
'Seems that way. ...But I'm really surprised.'
'What should I do, Ageha! What do you think I\nshould do?!!'
'Just settle down! You're beautiful, so I'm sure\nyou've gotten a love letter before, right?'
'Yes! Lots of them!'
'Right, so there's nothing to get so surprised\nabout.'
'...But that was before my legs became like\nthis.'
'Who is it from?'
'I don't know. Oh, there's a name written on it.'
'Let's see...Oh, it's Miyada from the Robotics\nClub. He's smart, has a handsome face, and is\npretty popular with the girls, you know!'
'I like you, Kotori. Please go out with me.' I\nsee.'
'I don't know what to do, Ageha!'
'What are you so troubled about? If you think it\nsounds good, you can date him. If you don't, you\ncan turn him down, right?'
'Um, but, I...'
'Oh, I guess you can try dating him and see how\nit goes, too.'
'Is that even a thing--?!'
'Pfft.'
'I don't know what to do! This is so hard!'
'Why?'
'Could it be that you like someone else?'
'...I hadn't even thought about that.'
After a while, only Ageha returned.
'Kotori says she didn't get enough sleep, so\nshe'll go back early. I'll see her off.'
'O, Okay.'
'See you later.'
She said only that, and then left again.
Somehow I felt like I was left behind.
'...Just what was that?'
There was something strange about Kotori's\nbehavior a second ago.
She was obviously hiding something.
'What in the world was she handed?'
'U, um, Aoi, That was, um...Uh...'
'Oh, sorry. If it's something you can't say,\ndon't worry about it.'
'It was a love letter, right?'
'Huh?'
'Yo- Yoru!'
'We can't just suggest it and lead him on without\nsaying it! I'd feel so bad.'
'Uhhh... ...I guess you're right.'
'A little while ago, when I was going home, a boy\nfrom a higher grade said he wanted me to give the\nletter to Kotori.'
'I tried to turn him down, but he was really\ninsistent. He begged and said I had to do it.'
'He seemed to know Sis was in the Soaring Club\nlike Kotori, so he entrusted the letter to her,\nwho is more approachable.'
'After all, Kotori's always with either you or\nAgeha.'
A love letter.
That's why she was making that face earlier.
At any rate, it was a love letter.
A love letter, huh...
'Aoi, what should we do?'
'What should we do? Shouldn't we just let things\nhappen as they will?'
'Kotori didn't seem altogether displeased.'
'...Not about that! I mean about today's club\nactivities.'
Ageha and Kotori had already gone back.
In this state, it would be difficult to continue\nworking.
'...Let's call it a day.'
'I'm sorry...'
'You look kind of happy about it!'
'Th, that's not true! I feel the same as always.'
'Miyada, huh? He's certainly not a bad person.\nHe's a bit dense sometimes, but he's a hard\nworker.'
'Is he nice?'
'Yeah, probably.'
'I see...'
'I thought you were going to turn him down right\naway, but I guess not.'
'Huh? Yeah...Well...I don't really know him,\nand...'
'...I'd hate to let this chance go to waste.'
'Kotori, have you dated any boys before?'
'How about you, Ageha?'
'It's a secret.'
'Huh? But you made me say it!'
'That's a bit surprising. You're so cute, I was\nsure you'd at least had a boyfriend before.'
'W, well, I was somewhat popular. Before, anyway.\nI think I said that earlier.'
'So why didn't you date anyone?'
'I wasn't really interested in that kind of\nthing...'

'What's more, boys would come even if I didn't do
anything, so I thought getting a boy would be
easy. I felt like If I wanted a boyfriend, I
could have one whenever...'
'...Had we met at that time, we probably wouldn't\nhave been friends.'
'I was young and stupid. I was still a kid at the\ntime.'
'And now you've realized that the world isn't so\nsimple.'
'...Yeah, I guess you could say that. But...'
'But?'
'It's fine. You have a nice opportunity, so take\ntime and think about it.'
'Thanks for taking me back.'
'No, it's fine. Besides, I was able to hear an\ninteresting story!'
'Everything I said is a secret, okay?'
'I know that! Especially to Aoi, right?'
'Of course! If he knew that I've never dated a\nboy, he'd laugh at me.'
'Mmm. I wonder about that!'
'Ageha...! Anyway, see you later.'
'I'm home!'
'Quack!'
'I'm home, Hat!'
'...Hehe.'
'Quack!'
'Look at this, Hat.'
'I got a love letter!'
'Quack?'
'Amazing, huh? ...Hey, don't eat it!'
'Hat, you tore it!'
'Quack!'
'A love letter for someone like me.'
'Quack?'
'...What should I do about this?'
After Kotori went home, I did a web search on a\nPC in the office.
'If I remember correctly, 1 Euro is about 110 yen\nright now, so... Whoa! This is expensive!'
'...Even if I use all of my savings, this will be\ndifficult.'
'But if I have this...'
'What are you looking at? A perverted site?'
'Wa!'
Ageha had come up behind me, so it was already\ntoo late to panic.
She was looking at the display from over my\nshoulder.
'...A foreign glider site?'
'Yeah, just taking a look.'
'Oh...Is this-- could it be...?'
'A cockpit for people with handicaps.'
I was looking at a German glider production\ncompany's website.

I had been gone to different glider-related
websites before and found it by chance. It seems
there are cockpits that allow people who can't
use of their legs to fly.
I cobbled together the limited information I had\nand finally found this site.
'But it's made in Germany.'
'Wow, I can't read it... Whoa, it's so expensive!\n...This price is prohibitive!'
'On top of that, it doesn't seem like you can\njust order it, either.'
I had read an account of a Japanese person who\nhad bought it. It seems they had to go through\nlegal procedures and all kinds of annoying stuff.
'And we don't even know if this can be attached\nto our glider.'
'After all, our glider has an original airframe.'
'But if we had this...'
'Yeah, we could have Kotori fly.'
I said that with a sigh, and Ageha laughed.
'What are you laughing about? You know as well as\nI that Kotori wants to fly, right?'
'Does she?'
'Don't play dumb.'
Kotori first said so around the time that Amane\nsaid, 'We don't have enough pilots.'
After that, she didn't say anything else about\nit, even once.
But looking at her, it was obvious.
'Has she already gone home?'
'Yeah, I took her home without a problem.'
'I see. How was she?'
When I asked, Ageha made a slightly surprised\nface.
'...Well, it seems she got a letter.'
'Oh, are you bothered by that?'
'I, I wouldn't say that, but.'
'Fine, I won't tell you!'
'Okay, I'm bothered by it! Tell me, Ageha-sama!'
'Um, well...I guess she didn't seem displeased.'
Saying that, Ageha took a side glance and watched\nfor my reaction.
She wanted to see what kind of face I'd make and\nwas implying something on purpose, but...
'(...I'm sure my agitation showed on my face just\nnow.)'
Just as I thought, Ageha smiled a cruel,\ncomplacent smile.
'She's going to think about it seriously.'
'Obviously.'
'She might actually date him!'
'Oh, you're getting upset!'
'You're having fun with this, aren't you?'
'Yep.'
'...You have such a charming personality.'
'Miyada isn't a bad person, after all. If he'll\nmake Kotori happy, I don't think it's a bad\nthing...'
She peeked at me.
'Quit watching for my reaction every time!'
'Shouldn't you go back?'
'She wants to be alone, so she went back early,\nright?'
'So I can't just intrude on her, can I?'
'Well, that's true.'
'But you're looking around foreign sites for\nKotori, so it seems a little bit...'
'I don't have anything else to do. What am I\nsupposed to do?'
'Then why not go back and study for tests or\nsomething?'
'Cut it out already! You don't have to tell me\nthat. I'll go back in a bit.'
'I should never have asked in the first place.'
While complaining, I was looking at the site in\nGerman.
It's been a year since I started preparing the\ndorm dinners with Kotori.
I'd gotten used to it, and we were a pretty good\nteam.
But as for today,
'(She's sighing again)'
She's been like this the whole time.
She's missing the spirit that she usually has.
'(I wonder if she's thinking about her reply to\nthe love letter...)'
Thinking about that, even I got restless.
'Hey, don't zone out like that when you're\nholding a knife!'
'Okay...'
'Hey, are you listening?'
'Yeah... Ouch!'
'See, I told you to be careful!'
'Kanako, can you get the first-aid kit?'
I called over to Kanako, who had been watching TV\nin the dining hall.
'All right!'
'Thank you very much. Show me the cut.'
Bright red blood was running down her slender,\nsupple fingertip.
'Doesn't seem that deep.'
I wiped the blood away with a tissue and then\napplied a bandage.
'...Thank you.'
'I don't know what happened to you, but don't\nzone out like that.'
'Okay. I'm sorry.'
Kotori answered while idly rubbing her fingertip,\nwhich was wrapped with the bandage.
After hesitating for a bit, I spoke.
'If you want to talk... I'll listen.'
'A, Aren't you worried about something? If you\nare, you can tell me.'
I was a bit embarrassed and said it in a bit of a\nblunt fashion.
Kotori was taken aback for a moment, and then,
'Okay. Thank you... But it's nothing.'
'I see.'
While answering, I felt a throbbing pain in my\nchest.
It was like a small needle being pushed in.
'I, It's true! It's nothing, OK?'
Kotori was probably panicking and following up\nlike this because I wasn't saying anything.
'Yeah, I got it.'
I smiled and replied.
This isn't good. Ever since learning about the\nlove letter, I've felt strange.
'Yo.'
'W, what is it?'
'Something feels a little off.'
'Really? Everything's the same as always!'
'Are you sure? But for you to burn your food... I\nthink this might be the first time!'
'Burn my...?'
Black smoke was swirling out of the frying pan.
'Oh no!! Why didn't you tell me earlier?'
'Well, I thought you were making a special kind\nof dish.'
'I guess I'll have to make it over...I wonder if\nthere are ingredients left over.'
This was adding insult to injury.
'I'll help, too, OK?'
'OK, please do.'
I wash the frying pan and make the main dish\nagain.
As Kanako had said, this is a first for me since\nentering Flying Fish Manor.
Since Kotori is helping me, it shouldn't take\nthat long, but still.
'...Anyway, what are you going to do this year?'
'About what?'
'Summer break. You aren't going to go home?'
As far as I know, Kotori has only gone home once\nthis year.
And even then, that was during the New Year.\nShe'd been driven by Hibari, and it was just for\na day.
'I'm not going home. Amane has come back, after\nall, so I don't have that much spare time.'
'I see.'
As unnatural as it sounds, I was relieved that\nKotori wasn't going home.
It wasn't about club activities.
It was because if Kotori had said she'd spend the\nentire summer break at home, I would have been\nreally lonely.
Final exams ended, and it was the last day of the\nfirst term.
During the boring closing ceremony, all I could\nthink about was Kotori.
It had been two days since she had received the\nlove letter from Miyada.
It seems she hasn't replied yet.
She wasn't as spirited as usual, and seemed\ndeeply immersed in thought pretty often.
I couldn't intrude, since she wasn't saying\nanything to me. Even if I tried, I wouldn't have\nany advice for her.
'But it does bother me...'
Ageha enjoys watching me worry endlessly as I\nhold onto these feelings I can't express.
At the moment, I'm alone.
Ageha said she was going shopping and left before\nme with the other girls from her class.
With a listless expression, Kotori said 'I don't\nfeel well...' and left, too.
'I guess I'll stop by the secret base and then go\nback.'
I don't have much to do, but it's better than\ngoing back to my dorm.
I was thinking that, when...
'Oh, this isn't good.'
After leaving the school gates, I saw Kotori and\nKanako.
Kanako is kneeling down and peering at the lower\nportion of Kotori's wheelchair.
'What happened?'
'Oh, Aoi. It seems her wheelchair won't move.'
It didn't seem like it had another flat tire.
'...The frame is bent, and the wheel is touching\nagainst it.'
'First aid won't do anything to help this.'
Kotori, sitting on the wheelchair, had an uneasy\nlook on her face.
'Hold on a sec.'
Trying to reassure her, I put my hand on Kotori's\nhead and took out my cell phone.
At a time like this, I could rely on An-chan.
'Oh, hey, An-chan. Are you OK to talk?'
I explained the situation to An-chan.
'You really saved me. Thanks.'
I hung up the phone and looked back at Kotori.
'If we leave the wheelchair somewhere An-chan can\nfind it, he says he'll pick it up and repair it.'
'He said it probably won't even take a day.'
'...I'm glad to hear that.'
Finally, Kotori had a look of relief on her face.
If the wheelchair breaks, Kotori can't go\nanywhere.
'Now we just have to think about how Kotori can\nget back to her dorm.'
'Shall I call a taxi?'
'Either that, or you can ride together on a\nbicycle.'
Kanako points at a bicycle that was sitting near\nus.
Kanako commutes to school by bicycle.
'No, that won't work.'
Kotori can't move her legs.
In other words, even if she sits down, it'll be\ndifficult for her to balance her body.
'Well then, shall I call a taxi?'
'I want to use the bicycle!'
Kotori suddenly spoke up.
'Put me on the bicycle!'
'Why are your eyes sparkling like that?'
They were sparkling as much as Asa's were when\nshe heard the word 'camp.'
'Well, using a taxi costs money...'
'And besides, I'd prefer using a bicycle.'
'You can pedal, Aoi. You were in the Cycling\nClub, right?'
'Kotori...!'
'Okay, I'll leave it to you, Aoi.'
Kanako spoke simply, left the bicycle, and\nstarted to walk.
'W, wait, Kanako!'
Kanako waved goodbye and just walked off.
'...I guess we have no choice.'
'W, whoa...!'
'Grab my arm! Don't let go!'
'O, okay...!'
I sat Kotori sideways onto the rack of the\nbicycle, which was on its stand.
I left the wheelchair near the school gates,\nwhere it could be seen.
This would allow An-chan to get it later. There's\nno way someone would steal it.
'Th, this is pretty high.'
Holding onto me, Kotori was shivering.
It was unstable and higher than a wheelchair, so\nI'm sure it was scary.
'Do you want to go for a taxi after all?'
'No, I want to use the bicycle!'
She was being stubborn as always.
'OK, whatever you do, don't let go. Got it?'
'Yep, I got it.'
After emphasizing that point, I sat on the\nbicycle seat and pedaled.
The bicycle slowly began to move.
'W, whoa... Whoaaaaa---...!!?'
'Wow! Wow! We're moving...!!'
'Please don't get too excited.'
'B, but...Whoa!'
(grip)
Kotori firmly held onto my back.
'Yes, just keep like that.'
'...Roger.'
With Kotori seated on the back, I glide down the\ngentle slope in front of the school gate.
I'm going slowly, but I pass by Keifuu students\nwho are walking home, one after another.
Everyone was looking at Kotori, who was in high\nspirits.
'Wow! Wow...!!'
Kotori is famous among students at our school. In\na lot of ways.
It was probably the first time for them to see\nKotori not sitting in a wheelchair.
Riding a bike like this, she looked like a\nregular girl that you would see anywhere.
'Amazing! We're going fast!'
'It's not scary?'
'Nope! Not at all!'
'...Well then, shall we take the scenic route?'
'Sure!'
Hearing Kotori's spirited reply, I put a bit more\nenergy into pedaling.
I branch off from the route I usually take and\nenter a different street.
Eventually the bike climbs up an embankment and\ngoes onto a road that runs alongside the lake.
'Whoaaa... The laaaaake!!!!'
From the road built on top of the embankment, one\ncould see all the way to the cliff on the other\nside of the lake.
The surface of the lake sparkled brilliantly in\nthe summer sun, and beyond that was a group of\nwindmills.
'This feels great!'
Kotori said this while feeling the wind against\nher skin.
'Bicycles are so great!'
'(panting) I know, right?'
I replied, feeling as though I was being\ncomplimented directly.
'Aoi, you seem tired.'
'I'm fine! I haven't ridden a bike for a while,\nso my body hasn't quite remembered the process\nyet. That's all.'
I must not have pedaled like this for about two\nyears.
The pedals of the bicycle are light, so even\npedaling hard doesn't move me very far forward.
'This is my first time to ride a bike!'
'Is that right?'
'Yep. I've never ridden one before.'
'It feels so good... If I could pedal by myself,\nI'm sure it'd feel even better.'
'Yeah.'
I reply in a bragging manner again.
'Does flying in a glider feel like this, too?'
'Hmm, I'm not sure about that.'
I'd imagine it's a looser feeling. In reality,\nit's faster than a bicycle, though.
'But the scenery is so great you can't even\ncompare it.'
'Whoa...'
'For a long time, I hadn't seen nature from\nanything but a wheelchair.'
'Even this is so refreshing for me.'
'Just by having my field of vision a little\nhigher, things look so different. It's a strange\nfeeling.'
Sitting on the rack, Kotori straightened her back\nas if to stretch.
'Whoa!'
'Oh no...!'
I lost my balance and became unsteady.
Kotori quickly grabbed onto my lower back.
'Th, that was scary! I thought I was going to\nfall!'
'I told you it was dangerous.'
'I, I'm sorry.'
If she falls, she'll definitely get injured.
I put my hands on Kotori's, which were on my\nlower back, and pulled them to tighten her grip.
'Oh, oh'
'Don't let go of me.'
'A, all right...'
I felt Kotori place her head on my back.
Perhaps because she was scared, she got much\ncloser to me than before.
I was a bit embarrassed, but it's dangerous to do\notherwise.
'I'm sweating...'
'Sorry.'
'No, it's not a bad thing.'
Saying that, Kotori pressed her cheek to my back.
'I feel more secure doing this.'
'I see.'
If Kotori presses against me, she'll sweat even\nmore.
But I couldn't exactly tell her to back off...
And further, I didn't object to her doing this,\neither.
'Don't you feel hot?'
'No, the wind feels good.'
A cool wind blew from the lake, fluttering\nKotori's long hair.
The sound of the wheels spinning felt good to my\nears.
I felt like everything around me suddenly got\nquiet.
I wanted to enjoy this comfortable atmosphere, so\nI decided to stop talking and just pedal.
Kotori wasn't talking, either. Maybe she felt the\nsame way.
Meanwhile, we were gradually getting closer to\nFlying Fish Manor.
When we turn right on the next corner, it will be\nright in front of us.
'Hey, Kotori.'
'Hm?'
'I heard you got a love letter.'
'...Yeah.'
'Have you replied yet?'
'No, not yet.'
'I see.'
'No reason, really. I just wondered what had\nhappened.'
We went silent again.
This was a silence different from a moment ago.\nIt was somehow awkward.
'I think I'll reply tomorrow.'
'Oh, really?'
'Are you worried? About what I'll reply with, I\nmean.'
'Yeah, well... A little, I guess. Have you\nalready decided?'
'...Not yet.'
'I see.'
(grip)
Kotori grabbed my lower back firmly.
'What's wrong? Are you scared?'
'...(shakes her head)'
She shook her neck so as to rub her head against\nmy back.
'...Doing this just makes me feel calm.'
'I see...'
Me too--I began to say it, but kept my mouth\nshut.
'This is a gravelly road, so we'll shake a bit.'
The bike went along the unpaved, gravelly road,\nand then entered a side road.
We are almost at Flying Fish Manor.
This moment of enjoyment will come to a close--
Thinking about that, I suddenly feel lonely and\ncome to a strong realization.
I have a crush on Kotori.
The first day of summer break.
'It's hot! The weather is really nice again\ntoday, huh...!'
While I was hanging my laundry to dry, Kotori\ncame through the entrance.
She was in her wheelchair, which An-chan had\nfixed and delivered the night before.
'Are you going out?'
'Y, yeah, for a bit.'
'I see. Come back by lunch, OK?'
'OK. See you.'
Kotori said that without looking at me, and then\nslyly left.
'Like an open book, as always.'
'Good morning!'
Ageha came just as Kotori left.
'Where's Kotori?'
'She left already.'
'Oh. So, shall we go, too?'
'All right.'
'I'm sorry.'
'I was so happy to hear how you felt. But... I\ncan't go out with you.'
'Why? Do you... hate me?'
'No, it's not that... I mean, I don't really know\nyou.'
'...Sorry to have bothered you, suddenly handing\nover a letter like that.'
'No, not at all! I mean it when I say I was\nhappy!'
'But... I can't.'
'...Are you going out with that Minase guy after\nall?'
'Huh?'
'I mean, you're always together, right? I saw you\non a bike together yesterday.'
'No, we're not dating.'
'Right now, my love is unrequited...'
'...My love with the sky.'
'The sky...?'
'I'm in love with the sky.'
'...(stifles laughter)'
'Y, you can't laugh, Aoi! ...They'll notice us!'
'B, but she... said she's in love with the sk...'
'S, she's speaking honestly, so you can't laugh.\nThe poor girl!'
'M, Miyada is just gawking at her, too...'
'I, I see... Well then, I guess it can't be\nhelped.'
'I understand, Kotori. I'll let it go, then.'
'I'm sorry, Miyada.'
'I hope your dream comes true.'
'Yep, I'll make it come true.'
'Oh, Miyada is leaving. Seems like they're done.'
'(panting) ...Somehow I got through it without\nlaughing.'
'She's actually serious about what she said...'
'She's an earnest person. But aren't you\nrelieved?'
'About what?'
'About Kotori not getting with Miyada.'
'N, not particularly. That Miyada, he seems like\na good guy.'
'Quit playing tough guy. Kotori's cute, so\nthis'll happen in the future, too.'
'You have to hurry up and get her!'
'Stay out of this.'
'I mean, she's... in love with the sky!'
I said it with a glum face, imitating Kotori.
Oh no! Remembering it, suddenly the urge to laugh\ncame back...
'...What are you guys doing here?'
An uneasy air came over the area.
'K, Kotori?!'
'Darn! We've been found!'
'...You two weren't watching me, were you...?'
'O, of course not, Kotori! We were just worried\nabout you, and...'
'Yeah, we were wondering what would happen if\nMiyada got forceful with you, and...'
'But I'm relieved. You let him down skillfully.'
'Yeah. You're in love with the sky! Another great\nphrase has been born!'
'Don't make fun of me...'
'Whoa! Hey, don't throw stones!'
'You! What's your problem?! I can be in love with\nwhatever I want!!'
'Whoa. That's dangerous, Kotori!'
'You have to try to break your habit of throwing\nthings when you get angry!'
'You two are worse for making me feel this way!!\nBoth of you are terrible! You have no\nsensitivity!'
'Aoi, I'll leave the rest to you!'
'What?! That's low, Ageha!'
'Whoa! I'm sorry! Please forgive me, Kotori! I'll\nbuy you ice cream!'
'There is no way I'll forgive you! Burn in hell,\nyou idiot!!'
'Aaaa----'
And this is how our summer break started this\nyear.
